org.jpac.plc

Class StringRxTx

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.plc.LobRxTx
      • org.jpac.plc.StringRxTx
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Value

    public class StringRxTx
extends LobRxTx
    Used to transfer a string value between the java application and the plc. Can be used standalone or in the context of a complex data structure (STRUCT)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.jpac.plc.LobRxTx

        address, conn, data, dataOffset, rxReq, rxTrans, txReq, txTrans

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringRxTx

        public StringRxTx(Connection conn,
                  Address address,
                  int dataOffset,
                  Data data)
           throws IndexOutOfRangeException
        Parameters:
        conn - an open TCP/IP connection to the plc
        address - address of the data item exchanged with the plc
        dataOffset - the byte offset inside LobRxTx.data, holding the data item to be exchanged with the plc
        data - instance of Data used to hold the data item exchanged with the plc.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfRangeException

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public StringRxTx set(PlcString value)
               throws AddressException,
                      StringLengthException
        used to set the data item to a given value.
        The data item is written to LobRxTx.data first.
        The actual transfer to the plc is done by invocation of LobRxTx.write(): aRxTx.set(aValue).write();
        Parameters:
        value - a value
        Returns:
        this. Useful in cases where the data item should be written to the plc immediately (see above).
        Throws:
        AddressException
        StringLengthException

      • get

        public PlcString get()
              throws AddressException,
                     StringLengthException
        used to set the data item to a given value. The data item is written to data first. The actual transfer to the plc is done by invocation of write(): aRxTx.set(aValue).write();
        Returns:
        this. Useful in cases where the data item should be written to the plc immediately (see above).
        Throws:
        AddressException
        StringLengthException

      • read

        public StringRxTx read()
                throws java.io.IOException
        used to read the data item from plc and store it inside LobRxTx.data.
        Overrides:
        read in class LobRxTx
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • clone

        public Value clone()
            throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Description copied from class: LobRxTx
        used to clone this LobRxTx. Cloneing comprises its address, its offset inside a containing data structure and its data REMARKS: the connection related properties such like Read-, WriteRequest or the connection itself is not cloned to avoid access from several threads. I/O over the connection should be done by the owner of the assigned signal
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Value
        Overrides:
        clone in class LobRxTx
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
